body.p: A Kentucky attorney and politician. Educated at common schools and a Hopkinsville academy. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1847. Practiced law in Cadiz and Hopkinsville. Member of the Democratic Party. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Served as clerk of the Trigg County Court from 1851 to 1853. Served the First Congressional District of Kentucky as a member of the United States House of Representative from the 1855 to 1861. Expelled from his congressional seat on December 3, 1861. Served in the Eighth Kentucky Infantry Regiment of the Confederate States. Served as president of the Russellville Convention in November 1861. Served as Representative of the Provisional Confederate Congress from 1861 to 1862. Served as a Kentucky Senator in the First and Second Confederate Congresses from 1862 to 1865.
